docs.snippet: A federal appeals court has handed a resounding victory to Washington state and Minnesota in their challenge of President Donald Trump's travel ban, finding unanimously that a lower court ruling suspending the ban's enforcement should stay in plac...
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court has handed a resounding victory to Washington state and Minnesota in their challenge of President Donald Trump's travel ban, finding unanimously that a lower court ruling suspending the ban's enforcement should stay in place while the case continues.

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump fumed on Wednesday over what he called too much politics in the U.S. judiciary, while a federal appeals court kept him and the rest of the country waiting for its ruling on a temporary suspension of his travel ban on seven M...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump fumed on Wednesday over what he called too much politics in the U.S. judiciary, while a federal appeals court kept him and the rest of the country waiting for its ruling on a temporary suspension of his travel ban on seven Muslim-majority countries.

headline.main: Trump Says Courts Too Political; No Travel Ban Ruling on Wednesday
headline.print_headline: Trump Says Courts Too Political; No Travel Ban Ruling on Wednesday

docs.snippet: Judges William Canby, Richard Clifton and Michelle Friedland range in age, backgrounds, and judicial decisions. The three judges on the San Francisco-based 9th Circuit Court of Appeals unanimously ruled Thursday against immediately reinstating Pre...
docs.lead_paragraph: Judges William Canby, Richard Clifton and Michelle Friedland range in age, backgrounds, and judicial decisions. The three judges on the San Francisco-based 9th Circuit Court of Appeals unanimously ruled Thursday against immediately reinstating President Donald Trump's travel ban, which temporarily suspended the nation's refugee program and immigration from seven mostly Muslim countries that have raised terrorism concerns. Here's a look at the justices and their questioning during arguments in the case this week:
